ml.alternet.parser.util

Interface ComposedRule<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the composition : Rule or List<Rule>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Grammar.Combine.Flattenable, Grammar.Combine.Simplifiable, TraversableRule.CombinedRule, TraversableRule.SimpleRule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grammar.AtLeast, Grammar.AtMost, Grammar.Bounds, Grammar.CharToken.Composed, Grammar.Choice, Grammar.Combine, Grammar.DropToken, Grammar.Optional, Grammar.Proxy, Grammar.Proxy.Deferred, Grammar.Proxy.Named, Grammar.Repeatable, Grammar.Sequence, Grammar.TypedToken, Grammar.TypedToken.Mapper, Grammar.TypedToken.Number, Grammar.TypedToken.String, Grammar.TypedToken.TypedNumber, Grammar.Wrapper, Grammar.ZeroOrMore

    public interface ComposedRule<T>
    Used for a rule that wraps another rule or that is a combination of several rules. There are 2 optimization axis :
    • Flattenization (horizontal optimization) : for example, a sequence made of sequence will be flatten to a single sequence
    • Simplification (vertical optimization): for example, a repeatable rule of a repeatable rule may be simplify to a single merged repeatable rule that combine the boundaries
    Those optimizations can occur on rules that are compatible : they must be of the same type, must have the same modifiers (@Fragment, @Skip), and must not be subject to substitution (Grammar.Rule.isGrammarField())
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

      Recursively flatten and simplify when possible the rules within, and flatten with this rule.

      Get a stream of composed rules.

      Set the combined rules within.
